node.title: The world's biggest meat processor says Huon Aquaculture is the start of its foray into seafood
node.alt: Pens of salmon in the ocean at Storm Bay, Tasmania.
node.description: Executives from Brazilian meat processing giant JBS have been in Tasmania surveying its new seafood company Huon Aquaculture ahead of its takeover next Wednesday.
node.content:
["Executives from Brazilian meat processing giant JBS have\u00a0been\u00a0in Tasmania surveying its new seafood company\u00a0Huon Aquaculture ahead of its takeover next Wednesday.", "Already, the company's Australian chief, Brent Eastwood has foreshadowed further investment in aquaculture in the country.", "\"This will be our first foray into aquaculture,\" he said.", "In Tasmania, JBS joins Tassal \u2014 Australia's biggest atlantic salmon producer and the only publicly listed salmon company \u2014 and Petuna, which is owned by the New Zealand-based business\u00a0Sealord Group.", "Last month Australia's Foreign Investment Review Board green-lit a takeover plan by JBS.\u00a0", "The takeover bid, announced in August, valued the company founded by Tasmanians Peter and Frances Bender at about $550 million, including debt.\u00a0", "", "
JBS chief executive\u00a0Brent Eastwood has spoken with ABC radio Hobart about the company's plans for Huon Acquaculture.(ABC Rural: Fiona Breen)
", "
No onshore salmon farming\u00a0for Huon
", "Mr\u00a0Eastwood has hosed down talk of moving salmon farming onshore, saying the\u00a0company has not yet seen evidence \"to back that up,\" despite the farming technique being investigated as an alternative in other parts of the world.", "\"We'll watch that carefully,\" he said.", "\"We haven't seen anything yet that means we shouldn't be continuing what we're doing. It's a very sustainable business now,\u00a0a clean business,\u00a0even though there's a lot of noise from certain areas.\"", "", "
Huon Aquaculture runs 11 farm leases around Tasmania.(ABC News: Paul Strk)
", "JBS is among the world's biggest meat processors, with operations that span the globe processing beef, chicken and pork. However, it was\u00a0a novice in the seafood space.", "", "
No major changes for Huon Aquaculture when new owners JBS take over the company next week
", "\"We are very new to the salmon industry. We are very impressed with the Huon set-up, the team, the strategy. We've done a lot of due diligence over the past few months and everything we've seen has further endorsed that it's a great business and a great company, \" Mr Eastwood said", "\"We think there are areas in their business that we can add good expertise and help.", "Huon Aquaculture will make up about 2 per cent of JBS'\u00a0global operations.", "
Business as usual for Huon
", "Speaking on ABC radio Hobart, Mr Eastwood reassured\u00a0staff and suppliers that it was\u00a0business as usual for Huon.", "\"We've spoken to many. We've given our strategy, our view and listened to what they have to say,\" he said.", "\"They've had concerns, but they've been going through a sales process for quite some time which is very uncomfortable and challenging so they're looking forward to a stable future with JBS.", "\"We\u00a0buy companies, but we don't sell.\"", "Mr Eastwood and John Berry \u2014\u00a0JBS' head of\u00a0corporate and regulatory affairs \u2014\u00a0also caught up with Huon's stakeholders, including the Bob Brown Foundation, The Tasmanian Alliance for Marine Protection, and author and industry critic Richard Flanagan.", "", "
The Ronja Huon will play a large role in the JBS operation.(By Fiona Breen)
", "\"We wanted to be open and transparent with everything we do. We requested those meetings. We wanted to listen to their concerns,\" Mr Eastwood said.", "\"They were good meetings. They were obviously very passionate about what they believe, and we have no problem with that. We listened, and we will continue to listen to all stakeholders in Tasmania,\"", "
JBS put on notice
", "Environmentalist Bob Brown said JBS \"made a few commitments\" but did not commit to \"providing us with baseline studies for Huon Aquaculture.\"", "Mr Brown and the Tasmanian Alliance for Marine Protection urged JBS to support the Dennes Point Declaration,\u00a0a document which supports an immediate transition out of the sea and into land-based farms.", "", "
Bob Brown, Bec Howarth and Christine Milne with the Bob Brown Foundation preparing to lobby JBS(ABC Rural: Fiona Breen)
", "\"They said they were here to listen to us. We said we were here to listen to them. They had nothing to offer \u2026 but when it came to what their future plans were they had nothing to offer,\" Mr Brown said.", "JBS already operates in Tasmania with a meat processing plant at Longford in the north of the state.", "Huon will now\u00a0be taken off the stock exchange.", "", "
The Ronja Huon vessel at Huon Aquaculture's Storm Bay farm, preparing to drop off some fish at the site.(By Fiona Breen)
"]
